title: Russia opens criminal case against Wagner Group chief after calls for armed mutiny
description: The announcement follows a statement from Wagner owner Yevgeny Prigozhin accusing Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu of ordering a rocket strike on Wagner's field camps in Ukraine.

title: 7.5 million Baby Shark bath toys have been recalled after causing puncture wounds
description: The company recalled mini and full-size versions of the toys after a dozen children were injured after sitting or falling onto them.

title: U.S. Starbucks workers join in a weeklong strike over stores not allowing Pride décor
description: Starbucks workers in cities including Chicago, Philadelphia and San Antonio plan to walk out or picket over coming days following worker accusations that the company is scaling back its LGBTQ support.

title: James Cameron says the Titan passengers probably knew the submersible was in trouble
description: The Titanic director has made 33 dives to the shipwreck and visited ocean depths in a submersible he built himself. He compares OceanGate to the Titanic in that both ignored safety warnings.

title: The U.S. Navy heard the likely implosion of the missing Titan sub on Sunday
description: The Navy, which was part of the unified command hunting for the Titan submersible, said it had acoustic data "consistent with an implosion" on Sunday at the start of a five-day search.

title: Kelly Clarkson wants you to know her new album isn't just a sad divorce record
description: On Chemistry, Clarkson's 10th studio album, she explores the rollercoaster of emotions she felt throughout her relationship with her ex-husband.

title: Supreme Court sides with the Biden administration in a fight over immigration
description: The Supreme Court handed President Biden's administration a major victory in a long-running dispute over how to enforce the nation's immigration laws.

title: The Supreme Court sides with the Biden administration in a fight over immigration
description: The case concerned the administration's effort to set guidelines for whom immigration authorities can target for arrest and deportation. Texas and Louisiana had sued to block the guidelines.

title: Step aboard the nuclear-powered passenger ship of tomorrow (from 1959)
description: The Nuclear Ship Savannah offers a snapshot of a nuclear future that never quite came to pass.

title: A year since Dobbs, these are the ways many states are protecting abortion
description: Abortion access has declined dramatically nationwide, but many states have further protected abortion by enacting "shield laws," allocating funding, stockpiling medication and repealing old laws.

title: Charities say Taliban intimidation diverts aid to Taliban members and causes
description: Aid workers in Afghanistan claim the Taliban is using threats and violence to control the way aid is distributed at a time when aid is more critical than ever.

title: Up First: Titan implosion; 1 year after Roe; Evan Gershkovich's appeal rejected
description: All five people aboard the Titan are believed dead after an implosion. Saturday marks a year since the Supreme Court overturned Roe. The FDA approves the first gene therapy for muscular dystrophy.

title: 3 things to know about Guatemala's elections
description: Voters will go to the polls on Sunday to elect a new president. But some of the most popular candidates won't be on the ballot.

title: What we've learned from pro-Trump attorney John Eastman's state bar trial
description: Attorney John Eastman was a key player in Donald Trump's legal efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election. The State Bar of California is now seeking to revoke Eastman's law license.

title: Denver psychedelics conference attracts thousands
description: Thousands are in Denver this week to learn about the future of psychedelics like magic mushrooms and MDMA, and to talk business.

title: Florida once again has a giant African land snail problem
description: The state is moving quickly to destroy the snails before the snails destroy Florida's crops. The snails contain both male and female reproductive organs and lay up to 500 eggs at a time.

title: Weekly news quiz: From 'no kill' meat to *that* billionaire cage match
description: Who or what is chicken? You decide in this week's NPR news quiz.

title: New abortion laws changed their lives. 8 very personal stories
description: After the Supreme Court ruled a year ago to overturn Roe v. Wade, more than a dozen states acted to outlaw abortion or severely restrict access. Here's how those laws affected the lives of residents.

title: One year after the Dobbs ruling, abortion has changed the political landscape
description: For decades, the politics around abortion were pretty well set. Then came the Supreme Court's Dobbs decision. It was a political earthquake, and in many ways the ground is still shaking.

title: Up past curfew, the party lasts all night at a basement dance club in Ukraine
description: Despite more than a year of war in Ukraine, regular missile strikes and power outages, the party goes all night long at a basement club in Kharkiv.

title: FDA warns stores to stop selling Elf Bar, the top disposable e-cigarette in the U.S.
description: The warning from the Food and Drug Administration is the latest attempt by regulators to crack down on illegal disposable vapes that have poured into U.S. stores in recent years.

title: Judge temporarily blocks Wyoming's 1st-in-the-nation abortion pill ban
description: Attorneys for Wyoming failed to show that the ban wouldn't harm the plaintiffs before their lawsuit is resolved, Teton County Judge Melissa Owens ruled after hearing arguments from both sides.

title: 3M reaches $10.3 billion settlement over contamination of water systems
description: The deal would compensate water providers for pollution with substances known collectively as PFAS, described as "forever chemicals" because they don't degrade naturally in the environment.
